page_content: This document provides contact information (address, phone, email, website) for the École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Beyrouth (ESIB), the Faculty of Engineering at Université Saint-Joseph de Beyrouth.

This document details the history of the **École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Beyrouth (ESIB)**, a pioneering engineering school in the Middle East. Founded in 1913 as **École Française d'ingénieurs de Beyrouth (EFIB)**, modeled after the École Centrale de Lyon, it initially focused on general engineering, evolving to include architecture and other specializations. After closures due to war and conflict, ESIB adapted to changing needs, modernizing its curriculum, expanding programs, and establishing partnerships with French institutions. It transitioned to the ECTS system, introduced English-taught programs, and continues to expand its offerings in engineering and technology, including programs in data science, artificial intelligence, and various engineering disciplines.

ESIB (École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Beyrouth) provides a strong Francophone engineering education, focusing on scientific and technical knowledge, along with skills like creativity and cooperation, to prepare students for diverse engineering careers.
ESIB's vision is to be a leading engineering school focused on high-level education, research, employment preparation, intercultural dialogue, and holistic student development.

This document details admission requirements for the École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Beyrouth (ESIB), including undergraduate and various Master's programs. Admission to undergraduate programs requires a Lebanese scientific Baccalaureate or equivalent, along with language proficiency in French or English. Master's programs have specific requirements based on the field of study, typically requiring relevant Bachelor's or Master's degrees. Application deadlines and processes vary depending on the program and semester.It also include entrance conditions and acceptance to the university.

ESIB tuition fees are paid in two installments per semester. In 2022-2023, it was $268 per credit for preparatory and engineering programs, totaling $8040 for 30 credits. 20% is paid in USD, 80% in Lebanese pounds (at 6000LL/USD). Financial aid is available.

ESIB's engineering program at the École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Beyrouth (ESIB) requires two years of preparatory classes (120 credits) followed by three years of specialized study (180 credits) in Electrical/Mechanical, Chemical/Petrochemical, or Civil/Environmental Engineering, leading to an engineering degree.
ESIB fosters a welcoming student life ("Vie associative") through active student associations that organize activities, address issues, and build lasting alumni connections.

The Aumônerie at ESIB (École Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Beyrouth) is a Christian-based organization welcoming all students. It offers a space for spiritual growth and reflection, including a campus chapel.

This document details the Master's in Data Sciences program at Saint-Joseph University of Beirut, designed to meet the growing demand for data scientists. The two-year, 120-credit program, validated by École Polytechnique de Paris, covers core data science topics like cloud computing, machine learning, data visualization, and enterprise data management. It includes a mandatory internship and culminates in a thesis. The curriculum encompasses courses in programming, statistics, database management, and specialized areas like web mining and social big data analysis, preparing graduates for careers in data analysis and decision-making.

This document details a two-year Master's program in Artificial Intelligence, designed to equip students with the skills to develop and implement AI solutions across various industries. The curriculum covers foundational topics in programming, mathematics, and AI, progressing to advanced areas like machine learning, data science, and specialized AI applications (e.g., cybersecurity, Fintech, computer vision, NLP). The program includes practical experience through internships or research theses, and culminates in a final semester dedicated to either. The program emphasizes both theoretical knowledge and practical skills, preparing graduates for careers as AI specialists. The curriculum also includes courses on ethics, legal considerations, and essential mathematical and statistical foundations for AI and machine learning.

This document details a Master's program in Renewable Energy offered by the Département des Etudes Doctorales, focusing on training engineers and researchers to address the growing demand in the field. The program, a collaborative effort between Lebanese and international universities, covers a broad curriculum including renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydro, biomass), energy storage, smart grids, sustainable building, and project evaluation. The program culminates in a research internship and thesis. Specific courses cover topics like bioenergy, wind energy, thermal system modeling, and distributed generation systems, with no prerequisites required.

This document presents the Master's program in Electrical Engineering at USJ. It highlights the growing importance of electrical energy in modern industry and outlines how recent technological advances—such as new electrotechnical materials and power semiconductors—impact the field. The program aims to prepare students for research, teaching, and high-level roles in both industry and public administration. The 120-credit program is spread over four semesters (MR1–MR4) and includes theoretical and practical coursework, seminars, industry visits, and a final research internship culminating in a public thesis defense. Courses span areas such as advanced power electronics, motor control, electrical machines, microprocessor systems, digital control, energy storage, and electrical network analysis. The program emphasizes MATLAB/Simulink simulations, FPGA/VHDL architectures, and converter modeling. Students also undertake mini-projects in the first two semesters and complete a 30-credit research thesis in the final semester.

The **Master en Management de la Sécurité Routière**, offered by the Département des Etudes Doctorales, aims to train road safety professionals to lead effective initiatives and eliminate road insecurity. The program, open to international students with a 4-year degree, covers a two-semester, 60-credit curriculum. It includes core courses on topics like intelligent transportation systems, vehicle safety, road design, user behavior, and accident management; a practical internship; and a research thesis. Graduates will gain expertise in data analysis, problem-solving, and communication, enabling them to excel in public, private, and social sector roles related to road safety.

page_content: This document details the curriculum for a Master's program in Oil and Gas Exploration, Production & Management, offered by ESIB in Lebanon. The program, designed to meet the growing demand for oil and gas professionals, covers both upstream (reservoir engineering) and downstream (economics and management) aspects. The curriculum includes courses on petroleum economics, financial markets, legal and fiscal aspects, and technical subjects like fluid mechanics, geology, and reservoir engineering. It also encompasses practical training, projects, and a final report. The program emphasizes the application of theoretical knowledge through real-world scenarios and aims to equip graduates with the skills needed to succeed in the Lebanese and international oil and gas industries. The document also outlines specific courses within the program, including those related to renewable energy, advanced mechanics, applied statistics, and various aspects of petroleum operations.

page_content: This document details the **Master Sciences de l'Eau** program at Université Saint-Joseph de Beyrouth, designed to address critical water resource challenges, particularly in Lebanon. The 2-year program (120 credits) trains specialists through theoretical and practical courses, research, and a thesis. The curriculum covers foundational topics like hydraulics and hydrology, specialized areas like biogeochemistry and water management, and practical skills in data acquisition and wastewater treatment. Courses include spatial and temporal series analysis, finite element methods, and fluid mechanics, with a strong emphasis on research and practical application. The program aims to foster expertise in water resource management, addressing issues of scarcity, quality, and sustainable use.

This document details the Master's program in Structures and Soil Mechanics at Saint-Joseph University of Beirut, a 2-year, 120-credit program designed to train civil engineers for research and careers in the field. The program covers a wide range of topics including structural analysis, material behavior, geotechnics, and seismic design, culminating in a research internship and thesis. The curriculum includes courses on advanced structural calculations, material behavior, soil dynamics, and fluid mechanics, with a focus on practical application and international collaboration. The program emphasizes the importance of civil engineering in socio-economic development and the role of technology in advancing the field.

page_content: This document describes the Master Télécommunications, Réseaux et Sécurité program, a two-year, 60-credit program offering specializations in Networks and Cybersecurity Engineering.  The program, a collaboration between Lebanese, French, and Canadian universities, trains engineers and researchers in telecommunications and security.  It includes theoretical courses, a mandatory internship (with a thesis and defense), and covers topics like network architectures, cryptography, cybercrime, network planning, and various network and software security aspects.  Specific courses delve into areas like network modeling, programming, security, and advanced radio techniques. All courses have no prerequisites.
